Whether you bleed maroon and white or are scoping out weekend jaunts with easy access from Dallas, there's a special kind of magic brewing in Aggieland. It's a place where new hotels eschew fancy dress but insist on fancy service, where fine dining and foodie breakfast spots are at home with sports bars. And everywhere, tradition, tradition, tradition. The region is experiencing a boutique hotel boomlet, with three new properties opening in early 2017 totaling nearly 500 rooms and suites. A rendering of the lobby at The Stella in College Station. A rendering of the king room at The Stella in College Station. The Stella 
This area has been underserved in upscale properties, observes Peggy Trott, general manager of The Stella , the Trust Hospitality hotel opening this spring in the area known as Research Valley or the Biocorridor. The nickname is derived from the spate of biotech companies and the nearby presence of Texas A&M Health Science Center . 
The hotel is situated in Lake Walk , an 180,000-square-foot lifestyle center with restaurants, retail, a 5-acre lake, pavilion and hiking trails. We see lots of family reunions and proposals in its future! Campfire restaurant will be integrated into the Stella's open lobby, and a bar named Herschel's pays homage to the original ranch owner and Aggie football player Herschel Burgess . 
Frette linens and freestanding tubs in some rooms add luxury touches, while the outdoor Back Yard and two pools outfitted with cabanas complete the resort feel. 
A deal: The hotel now has a Grand Opening Offer for all guests who book a stay through July 31, which includes 20 percent off the best available rate and two specialty cocktails. Cavalry Court hotel in College Station (Cavalry Court) Cavalry Court hotel in College Station (Cavalry Court) Cavalry Court hotel in College Station (Cavalry Court) Cavalry Court 
A few miles away lies Cavalry Court , the first of the new hotels to open. Located inside Century Square, a mixed-use development adjacent to A&M, it is, for now, hard to find inside a construction zone. But that hasn't stopped the locals. 
Texas A&M football coach Kevin Sumlin has discovered the Canteen sports bar and lounge. He spent a Saturday afternoon watching the Patriots-Texans game. And the locals who swarmed in the next night for the Cowboys-Packers game have figured it out, too. Canteen bar and restaurant at Cavalry Court hotel in College Station (Cavalry Court) 
The 141-room hotel revels in its military theme, nods to A&M's Corps of Cadets and the Parsons Mounted Cavalry. Fun touches: camo-print carpets, at ease/do-not-disturb magnets, military green armoires styled as lockers, canteen-style water pitchers and mess kit-inspired flatware. Two century trees are preserved on the property, a nostalgic spot for a fun, tradition-filled wedding reminiscent of the famous century tree on the Aggie campus. The Canteen is a live music venue on weekends and sports bar that opens onto the pool area, fire pits, cabanas and a pavilion. It's one rockin' furlough indeed. Rendering of the lobby at The George hotel in College Station. The George 
Just across from Cavalry Court and still under construction is the 162-room hotel called The George , named for two beloved Georges around town, the 41st president and philanthropist George Mitchell. The two hotels are owned by Midway and managed by Valencia Group. Elevated Egg Sandwich at First Watch in Bryan, Texas (First Watch) What to do while you're there 
While Bryan College Station is a natural draw for A&M events, there's plenty to keep a visitor busy even when the university's quiet. Here are five stops on the itinerary, whether your trip brings you to a game, reunion, graduation, business meeting or girlfriends' trip. Visit 
George Bush Presidential Library and Museum : The museum focuses on post-1941 U.S. history and includes artifacts from World War II, a replica of the Oval Office and a special section devoted to first lady Barbara Bush. A Presidents Day event on Feb. 21 features author Kate Andersen Brower , who has written books about the White House and former first ladies. Stroll 
Downtown Bryan is a thriving shopping district with art galleries, boutiques and eclectic stores such as Ed's Bookshop , a used book store. If you're a fan of historic hotels, check out the La Salle , a Texas historic landmark occupying seven stories. It had many lives before being restored and available for guests beginning again in 2000. downtownbryan.com . Fresh Berry Napoleon at Christopher's World Grille in Bryan, Texas Christopher's World Grille Dine 
For a white tablecloth experience, head to Christopher's World Grille , located in a 100-year-old ranch house. The 15-year-old restaurant is helmed by Christopher Lampo and features an eclectic, globally inspired menu, as the name implies, and well-chosen wine list. First Watch restaurant in Bryan, Texas First Watch Wake-up call 
A new favorite is First Watch , an upscale breakfast chain featuring health-minded bowls and veggie juices along with gargantuan pancakes and classic egg dishes. Word to the uninitiated: Download the Nowait app to avoid the hour-long wait. Sip 
A Brazos Valley fixture since 1977 and the fourth winery in Texas, Messina Hof Winery & Resort has ridden Texas' wine industry boom and remains a beloved spot. The property includes an 11-room bed-and-breakfast and Vintage House Restaurant. If you get in early enough on a Friday, enjoy a moonlight winery tour from 7 to 8 p.m., with a wine and tapas tasting afterward. View Comments
